## **Previously on 201**
<br>
### Midterm <br><br>
### Semantics
  - **Lexical Semantics**: the meaning of words (or lexical items)
  - **Compositional Semantics**: the meaning beyond words (phrases, sentences, e.g.)<br><br>

### **truth value**: if a proposition is **TRUE** or **FALSE** <br><br>
### **possible worlds**: an alternative reality where we want to check on the proposition's **truth value**

.pull-left[

## **Semantic Relations**
<br>
.pull-left[
- **synonym:** words that have the same reference / refer to the same set of things in the world
  - <span style="color:green"><b>drinks</b></span> and <span style="color:green"><b>beverages</b></span><br><br>
- **hypernym:** words whose reference is a **superset** of another words reference<br><br>
  - <span style="color:green"><b>student</b></span> is a hypernym to <span style="color:green"><b>linguistics student</b></span><br><br>
- **hyponym:** words whose reference is a **subset** of another words reference
  - <span style="color:green"><b>dog</b></span> is a hyponym to <span style="color:green"><b>mammal</b></span><br><br>
- **antonym:** words that have opposite meanings
]
.pull-right[
<img src="../pic/1017/seman2.jpg" width="65%">
]

---
## **Semantic Relations: Antonyms**
<br>
.pull-left[
- **complementary pairs:** items that can't be in both categories
  - <span style="color:green"><b>alive</b></span> vs. <span style="color:green"><b>dead</b></span><br><br>
  
- **gradable pairs:** opposite ends of a scale
  - <span style="color:green"><b>young</b></span> vs. <span style="color:green"><b>old</b></span><br><br>
  
- **reverses:** opposite directions
  - <span style="color:green"><b>up</b></span> vs. <span style="color:green"><b>down</b></span><br><br>
  
- **converses:** same action, different perspective
  - <span style="color:green"><b>buy</b></span> vs. <span style="color:green"><b>sell</b></span><br><br>
]
.pull-right[
<img src="../pic/1017/seman3.png" width="100%">
]

## **ENTAILMENT** <br><br>

### sentence **p** entails sentence **q** <span style="color:green"><b>iff</b></span> **q** is true <span style="color:green"><b>whenever</b></span> **p** is true.<br><br>

### <span style="color:green"><b>iff</b></span>: if and only if
### "<span style="color:green"><b>whenever</b></span>": it means you cannot find any possible world, 
### where **q** is **false** while **p** is **true**

---
class: middle, center

## **ENTAILMENT** <br><br>

### sentence **p** entails sentence **q** <span style="color:green"><b>iff</b></span> **q** is true <span style="color:green"><b>whenever</b></span> **p** is true.<br><br>

### <u>Merlin is a Linguistics student</u>. ***entails*** <u>Merlin is a student</u>. <br><br>
### If Merlin is **NOT** a student, it means
### there is **NO** possibility for Merlin to be a Linguistics student.

## **Logical Entailment**<br><br>
.pull-left[
- **p** *entails* **q** for logical reasons, **regardless** of world knowledge or lexical meaning <br><br>
**p**: <span style="color:green"><b>The cat sat on the mat.</b></span> <br>
**q**: <span style="color:blue"><b>There is a cat/mat.</b></span> <br><br>
**p**: <span style="color:green"><b>(a dog): I heard the can opener.</b></span> <br>
**q**: <span style="color:blue"><b>(Therefore for the dog), FOOD EXISTS!.</b></span> <br><br>
- We got the entailment relation between **p** and **q** by logical inferences
]
.pull-right[
<img src="../pic/1017/entail1.png" width="75%">
]

---
## **World-specific Entailment**<br><br>
.pull-left[
- **p** *entails* **q** due to <span style="color:green">world knowledge</span> or <span style="color:green">lexical meaning</span><br><br>
**p**: <span style="color:green"><b>Charles III is the King of the United Kingdom.</b></span> <br>
**q**: <span style="color:blue"><b>Queen Elizabeth II was Charles's mother.</b></span> <br><br>
**p**: <span style="color:green"><b>Merlin is from Scotland. </b></span> <br>
**q**: <span style="color:blue"><b>Merlin is from UK.</b></span> <br><br>
- We got the entailment relation between **p** and **q** by making reference to how the world works, or to knowledge of lexical meaning
]
.pull-right[
<img src="../pic/1017/entail3.png" width="75%">
]

---
## **Mutual Entailment**<br><br>
.pull-left[
- **p** *entails* **q** <span style="color:green"><b>AND</b></span> **q** *entails* **p** as well.<br><br>
**p**: <span style="color:green"><b>Merlin is a sorcerer.</b></span> <br>
**q**: <span style="color:blue"><b>Merlin is a wizard.</b></span> <br><br>
**p**: <span style="color:green"><b>Merlin is immortal </b></span> <br>
**q**: <span style="color:blue"><b>Merlin is not capable of dying.</b></span> <br><br>
]
.pull-right[
<img src="../pic/1017/entail4.png" width="75%">
]
